titlestmt.titleproper: Russell Sage Foundation records, Microfiche Collection
A Guide to the Russell Sage Foundation records, Microfiche Collection FA1841

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-04-01 07:44:44 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Russell Sage Foundation records, Microfiche Collection

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This microfiche collection, filmed by UPA Academic Editions, primarily documents the activities of the Russell Sage Foundation from its inception in 1907 through their admininstrative restructuring in 1947.

This collection is comprised of publications, including pamphlets and series, select historical documents from the RSF archives at Rockefeller Archive Center, and a complete set of minutes of the Board of Trustees and Executive Committee meetings from 1907-1947.

Monographs, books, and other library items were not filmed as part of this microfiche collection, but microfilm of select library items are available elsewhere in the Russell Sage Foundation collection at Rockefeller Archive Center.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with brittle or damaged items available at the discretion of RAC.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged as received, in series or subseries by subject/topic.

did.unittitle: Operations and Finances - Other Policy Matters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes publications or documents written by/to: John M. Glenn; Robert W. deForest; Johnston deForest; Shelby M. Harrison.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Board of Trustees managed the Russell Sage Foundation's business and assests. The material represented includes: descriptions of grants, records of actions, activities, and appointments, salaries, major policy decisions, and financial statements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Executive Committee of the Russell Sage Foundation during this period was comprised of the President, the Vice President, and three trustees. It held the power of the Board of Trustees between meetings of the full board, yet met irregularly.

The material here documents Executive Committee actions which often included preparation of proposals or reports for consideration by the Board of Trustees, as well as any any grant approvals or other considerations directly acted upon by the EC.
